title: Metadata items not seen in response body of Create Volume

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rohitk

comments.content:
This is actually correct behavior.  The GET returns not only the volume reference, but also includes a joined load on the volumes metadata and type tables as well.

The actual create ONLY returns the volume reference itself.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~john-griffith

comments.content:
John,

Ideally end user should actually do a GET to verify volume details, but still, the post response should either contain ALL items correctly, not just name, description etc. 
And if the metadata is not required then it should be removed from the response altogether, no?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rohitk

comments.content:
Rohit,

Yes, you're correct... ideally the create would omit the metadata heading altogether.  Currently we're using a shared function to translate the results whether it's a GET or a create, thus the reason you see the odd behavior.

I'll reopen and make a fix to this if you agree that it's acceptable?

Thanks,
John
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~john-griffith

comments.content: Sure John, that would be better. Thanks!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rohitk

comments.content: Create takes metadata therefore should include valid metadata in the response.  Add metadata to returned object in db volume_create.

commit 5b605b6b8ae00f51deac5e0531f7aeda9bd11019
Author: John Griffith <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Jul 27 22:30:47 2012 -0600

    Include volume_metadata with object on vol create
    
    Fix for Bug 1029762
    
    The symptom of this bug is that the response data of an
    OSAPI create call always shows and empty dict for volume_metadata
    regardless of what was passed in to created and actually used.
    
    Upon the db create_volume call a reference to the volume
    object is all that was being returned.  Since metadata is
    specified and set, it should also be returned with the
    create reference object.
    
    This will result in the the osapi create call returning
    a body with correct metdata info rather than always showing
    and empty dict as it was previously.
    
    Change-Id: I9ae9c737bd2aa5bfa14c19fe8b8b2a7a5aa4d43a
